definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: The keepers, Fiori and Kalac , trained apart.
sentences.chinese: 门将费奥里和卡拉奇，在一旁训练。

sentences.english: You may need a good goalies for instance. Take your time however.
sentences.chinese: 比如说不论如何你都需要一个好的门将。

sentences.english: He picked out Wazza, and he stretched his leg out and managed to guide it past the keeper.
sentences.chinese: 他将球挑给鲁尼，后者伸长了腿，让球越过了门将。

sentences.english: Vida's also developed a great understanding with his keeper, Edwin van der Sar, which can't be underestimated.
sentences.chinese: 维达能很好的与门将范德萨交流，这点不容低估。

sentences.english: The former Atletico Madrid keeper is wasting little time becoming integrated at United and adapting to his new surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 前马竞门将正在尝试融入球队，并与新队友配合。

sentences.english: The goalies trained apart under Vecchi and Abate.
sentences.chinese: 门将则在维奇和阿巴特教练的带领下单独训练。

sentences.english: When the timer runs out the door will be locked forever, locking away the antidote inside it.
sentences.chinese: 到时门将永久被锁住，解药也会以后封存。

sentences.english: Can keepers get sent off or injured this year?
sentences.chinese: 本作中门将可以受伤或被罚下吗？

sentences.english: What I do know is that Clemence was probably the best goalkeeper in Liverpool's history.
sentences.chinese: 我只知道克莱门斯可以算是利物浦历史上最好的门将。

sentences.english: He is even-tempered and is a great keeper.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名冷静和出色的门将。

sentences.english: Goalkeeper Matteo Sereni has returned to the negotiating table over extending his stay with Lazio.
sentences.chinese: 门将塞雷尼重新开始了和拉齐奥的续约谈判。

sentences.english: Look, when the messenger comes, shut the door and hold it shut against him.
sentences.chinese: 你们看着使者来到，就关上门，用门将他推出去。

sentences.english: If United fail at Anfield the league would be open for us.
sentences.chinese: 假如曼联败走安菲尔德，联赛之门将会为我们打开。

sentences.english: The position of goalkeeper is moot.
sentences.chinese: 阿森纳门将位置至今悬而未决。

sentences.english: David is a very good goalkeeper and is improving day-by-day.
sentences.chinese: 德赫亚是个很好的门将，每天都在进步。

sentences.english: First to use a trio of keepers were France in 1978.
sentences.chinese: 第一支用满三名门将的球队是1978年的法国队。

definition: middle period of a tripartite provincial exam (in former times)/midfield/mid-court (in sports)/half-time/intermission half-way through a performance
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
Zhongwei prefecture level city in Ningxia
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
